meanings.definition: A group of people leading the way in new developments or ideas.
meanings.sent1: The vanguards of the science club always come up with cool experiments.
meanings.sent2: The vanguards in technology are always inventing new gadgets.
meanings.sent3: The vanguards of the book club decided to read novels backward for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative vanguards in fashion turned heads at the show.
meanings.sent5: The vanguards of the art world painted with invisible colors, surprising everyone.

meanings.definition: The foremost part of an advancing army or naval force.
meanings.sent1: The vanguards led the army into battle with courage.
meanings.sent2: The vanguards marched ahead, ready for any challenge.
meanings.sent3: The vanguards decided to have a dance-off before the battle, lightening the mood.
meanings.sent4: The vanguards pierced through the enemy lines like a sharp sword.
meanings.sent5: The vanguards stood tall, their flags waving proudly in the wind.

meanings.definition: A position at the forefront of new developments or ideas.
meanings.sent1: She secured a vanguards role in the company's innovation team.
meanings.sent2: The vanguards in research always discover groundbreaking solutions.
meanings.sent3: The vanguards organized a silly hat competition to boost creativity.
meanings.sent4: His vanguards in marketing revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent5: The vanguards of education built a bridge to knowledge for all students.
